title: Ussur
body:
History

Origins - The Age of Empires

When Mant Nukko, ruler of Ukunur, was murdered, the city of Ukunur fell into a state of turmoil. Many fled the city to find safer lands within the province and various civil wars ensued. Ultimately Ukunur fell into disrepair. Its building materials were ransacked and the great fortress of Gor'Tantil was destroyed brick by brick.

The Age of Uncertainty

A large settlment grew to the West of Ukunur's ruined remains, and much of the material stolen from the city was used to build new structures in the settlement. Many of the displaced former citizens of Ukunur made there way to this new settlement, now called Ussuru (etymology uknown),

Hearing of the new settlement, Borna Glorsai, a student of Fenraye Huddah's Temple Altagoran located in modern day Altaglake, decided to build a temple at the heart of the new settlement. With only ten or so moons having passed since the publication Nexurkaan (and the subsequent overthrowing of Mant Nukko), many of the citizens of Ussuru were eager to accept the Spirits, and with the aid of thousands of volunteers the great Temple of Alkaasuru (believed to be a combination of Altagoran (Table), Kaan (People) and Ussuru, the "Ussurian's People's Table", or more concisely "The Ussurian's Table") was built at the Eastern base of the Westward hill of Kwalla-Lai.

The Age of Beginnings

The arrival of the Temple brought a great influx of settlers, who considered a sacred city - one that was free of the violence outside of its borders. This attitude ot the Spirits has largely continued through into the Age of Awakening, and Ussur's citizens remain the most Spiritual of all the Inditt Region's city populaces.

Geography

Location

Ussur is located in the South-East parts of the Inditt Region. The city is built between two great hills: the Westwards hill of Kwalla-Lai (Brother Hill) and the Eastwards hill of Kwalla-Norai (Sister Hill). The Ussurian province stretches in all directions from the city. In the South are the Ussurian Laylands, a largely unused area which contains miles of wild Yugga, as well as Northward, Eastward and Westward expansions which are used for agriculture until the more fertile grounds turn into arid desert.

Climate

During the Summer Season, the combination of Ussur's reduced elevation and the two hills of Kwalla-Lai and Kwalla-Norai give the city its cooler climate. The hills trap moisture from air and hydrate the soil below, whilst the terrain on which the city is built is sunken, allowing for the cooler air stay trapped within the natural basin.

Autumn brings heavy rains and fog. The streets become muddy and crops that flourish in Summer and Autumn experience a lull in their usual output. The Ussurian farmers plant Autumn-specific crops to cope with the wetter conditions.

Winter is a very icy affair in Ussur. The hills of Kwalla-Lai and Kwalla-Norai become ice-capped, and the water brought by the Autumn freezes over to create a semi-permenant ground frost. Crops grow sparse during this time, and the meat of animals who can bare the cold weather become the main food source.

Spring in Ussur is notable cooler than Summer, but the same Summer crops excel in the seasonal harvest. Once the ice has thawed and the sodden ground has dried (usually taking a year or two after the end of Winter), favourable agricultural conditions return.

Governance

Temple Collective

The city is governed by the Spiritual elite of the Temple Collective - twelve elected candiates, comprising of one leading High Priest or Priestess (usually a Priestess) and eleven Ren-Luzzo. The Ren-Luzzo are elected officials from any of the twelve Inditt Temples, including the Alkaasuru/Ussur itself. This process brings unique perspectives and knowledge from the other cities, but also enables Ussur to hold positions of power and persuasion across the region.

Architecture

City Fortification

Ussur is an unwalled city, but is protected by great guard towers on each of its adjacent hills, and a number of outposts, arsenals, garrisons and other fortifications throughout the city and on the roads leading towards into city.

City Layout

Without the presence of city walls to confine and segment the city, Ussur is open-plan in its construction. The Temple of Alkaasuru lies at the heart of the City, which is also the lowest point of the geographical basin, and from this central point a number of roads lead outwards. Connected between these roads are streets and allies, giving the heart of the city a web-like appearance. Towards the outer presincts of the city, streets and buildings are less orderly, leading to winding streets and disjointed buildings.

Provincial Architecture

Most buildings outside of the city centre are of timber construction. These include, but are not limited to, Farmhouses, Stables, Barns, Inns and Markets.

Notable Locations

  • The Temple of Alkasuuru
  • The Towers of Kwalla-Lai and Kwalla-Norai
  • The Sin'quin Chapel
  • The Shrine of the Fallen Spear
  • The Golden Market
  • The Iron Bells

Economy

Agricultural produce is Ussur's main economy. With food and water being amongst the most lucrative products in the arid Inditt Region, Ussur continues to amass great wealth from the constant supply of both due to its unique geography and climate. This wealth has translated into secondary exports, such as fine clothing, jewellery, weapons and armour, and art.

Military

The Ussurian army is the largest in the Inditt Region at around 3000-5000 strong, depending on the season.


A city force of about 800 strong called the Ussurian Guard is used for law enforcement, as well as acting as a deployable unit in battle.

Ussur's main military force is the Bronze Shields, comprised of swordsmen and pikemen. However, a small unit of 100 elite Edre-Ugalasin, Moon Hunters, infantry are available. This elite force is made from the top performing soldiers across all divisions, whereupon they are specially trained for maximum impact combat whilst forgoing their fear of death.


The Ussurian army's armour is of a bronze colour, and use slightly curved swords as their main weapon. Armoured Bhesacks are used as crowd control, as well as being deployed in the Battle of Darkness.
preface: Ussur is a city province in the Inditt Region. Whilst its province is the largest in the region, the city is only the second largest. It is a relatively affluent area, containing the largest area fertile land in the Inditt Region. It is also the biggest net importer of goods.
